title: Finding the Total Mean: Freddie Just Cannot Get to School on Time
question_text:
Freddie has a problem of showing up to school on time. Freddie has broken down how his time (in minutes) is spent before school into four parts. The four parts consists of getting out of bed (Freddie likes to hit that snooze button), getting ready for school, driving to school, and walking to class (Freddie is a bit of a social butterfly).
The chart below shows the mean and standard deviation of the number of minutes it takes Freddie to complete each one of these tasks.
MeanStandard Deviation
Getting out of bed20.136.23
Getting ready12.854.14
Driving to school8.262.34
Walking to class7.341.79


What is the total mean time of Freddie's four part morning schedule?
